alert.note: Alert for Custer; El Paso; Fremont; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 29 at 7:17AM MST until November 29 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Fremont County in central Colorado... Northeastern Custer County in southeastern Colorado... Southern El Paso County in east central Colorado... Northwestern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 800 AM MST. * At 716 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 8 miles northwest of Pinon, or 20 miles north of Pueblo, moving east at 30 mph. This snow squall will affect the I-25 corridor from southern El Paso County into northern Pueblo County. It will also affect the US-50 in the Pueblo West region. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Fountain, Florence, Hanover, Yoder, Truckton, Royal Gorge, Penrose, Canon City, Rush, Security-Widefield and Pueblo West. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
